abstract: Experts and researchers say working conditions for women on Wall Street have improved only marginally in twenty-six years since landmark class-action suit known as 'boom-boom room' suit, in which 23 women sued Smith Barney brokerage firm for sexual harassment and pay discrimination; while women are no longer subjected to more blatant forms of harassment and discrimination, there remain pay and promotion disparities between men and women.
lead_paragraph: Sexual harassment is less blatant, but complaints continue about pay and promotion disparities and limited ability to recover damages.

headline.main: Decades After ‘Boom-Boom Room’ Suit, Bias Persists for Women
headline.print_headline: Decades After Suit, Wall St. Bias Persists for Women

snippet: Sexual harassment is less blatant, but complaints continue about pay and promotion disparities and limited ability to recover damages.
